page.title: 10 TRANSPORT IN THORLEY
page.content: Most residents of this suburb rely on their own means of transport.Families have 1 or 2 cars & use them for long & short journeys.Although there is a public bus service through the estate it is infrequent & the only proper stop is at the shopping centre. Elsewhere the driver stops on request.Many residents, particularily mothers pushing prams,are worried about having to walk around on the road verges because some areas have no pavement.A few ride bicycles buth this can be dangerous due to the speed of traffic on the through roads. Residents agree that a by-pass is needed for the west of Stortford to link up with the existing northern one at the A120 roundabout.
